subject: Technology
title: Unix and the Server World
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Unix and the Server World.

hook.text: Most websites you visit don't run on Windows. They run on a system born in 1969 at Bell Labs.

buildup.text: Unix was designed to be simple, modular, and able to run on many different machines.

discovery.text: Its philosophy: each program should do one thing well. Chain small tools together for complex tasks.

twist.text: Unix spawned dozens of variants. Linux, macOS, and Android all trace their roots back to it.

climax.text: Over 90% of the world's servers, and every Android phone, run Unix-based operating systems.

punchline.text: An OS from 1969 quietly runs most of the modern world.

quiz.question: Which modern systems are based on Unix?
